Description: Fragment of body of East Greek pottery open vessel; two friezes separated by a band with added red lines; rear of goat to left above, forepart of goat grazing to right below. Interior painted brown with large tongue with incised outline.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 219, no. 64)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.878)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.5961 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
